page.title: 08Newburgh Festival Week
page.content: Every year during the summer holidays there is a Festival Week. This year it is being held on the 11th of August till the 17th of August, 1985. During the week there are games and open air discos for children.There is also a Pageant held at Lindores Abbey, where members of the theatre group take part. The opening of the festival last year was held at the bottom of Mugdrum Park which had a miniature train and the fire engine was on display. The Army was also there displaying their dogs. One of the events held during the Festival Week is a Pram Race in which people dress up as babies and run through the streets pushing prams and visiting the pubs. A Festival Queen is chosen at the first disco. There are also many other activities.
